medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles module¶

medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.boundary(binaryimage)¶

pass a binary image, it will return an image of the boundaries. this is useful when you pass the controlregion

medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.colorfulcontours(im, contourlist)¶
medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.create_speckle_aperture(im, cx, cy, rad)¶
medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.create_speckle_mask(image, pos, cx, cy, speckle_rad)¶

returns a binary map with ones in the region of the speckle (circle of radius speckle_rad)

medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.detect_speckles(image, configfile=None)¶

Returns a set of contours defining the speckles

medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.detect_speckles2(image, configfile=None, speckle_positions=None, configspecfile=None)¶

Returns a orderdered (brighter to fainter) list of pixels at speckle centers

medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.detect_speckles3(image, configfile=None)¶

Takes an image and detect the peaks usingthe local maximum filter. Returns a boolean mask of the peaks (i.e. 1 when the pixel’s value is the neighborhood maximum, 0 otherwise)

medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.filtercontours(image, contours, N=60)¶

returns the top N brightest contours

medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.get_speckle_photometry(image, aperture_mask)¶

returns the integrated flux of the speckle defined in the area of aperture mask

medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.get_speckle_photometry_old(image, aperture_mask)¶

returns the integrated flux of the speckle defined in the area of aperture mask

medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.get_speckle_spatial_freq(image, pos, cx, cy, lambdaoverd, angle=None)¶

returns the spatial frequency of the speckle defined in the area of aperture mask

medis.speckle_nulling.detect_speckles.threshold(image, region, method='mean', window=5, offset=-3)¶

Uses an adaptive threshold to separate a region into two parts of zeros and ones. options: method: mean, gaussian window: 5 offset: -3

medis.speckle_nulling.dm_functions module¶

medis.speckle_nulling.dm_functions.amplitudemodel(counts, k_rad, a=0, b=0, c=0)¶

Radial dependence of spot calibration

amplitude = sqrt(counts/(a*k_rad**2 + b*k_rad + c))

medis.speckle_nulling.dm_functions.annularmask(N, inner, outer)¶
medis.speckle_nulling.dm_functions.circularmask(N, rad)¶
medis.speckle_nulling.dm_functions.convert_kvecs_pixels(kx, ky, centerx=None, centery=None, angle=None, lambdaoverd=None)¶

converts wavevector space to pixel space

medis.speckle_nulling.dm_functions.convert_pixels_kvecs(pixelsx, pixelsy, centerx=None, centery=None, angle=None, lambdaoverd=None)¶

converts pixel space to wavevector space

medis.speckle_nulling.dm_functions.intensitymodel(amp, k_rad, a=0, b=0, c=0)¶

Radial dependence of spot calibration

intensity = amp**2*(a*k_rad**2 + b*k_rad + c)

medis.speckle_nulling.dm_functions.make_speckle_kxy(kx, ky, amp, dm_phase)¶

given an kx and ky wavevector, generates a NxN flatmap that has a speckle at that position

medis.speckle_nulling.dm_functions.make_speckle_xy(xs, ys, amps, phases, centerx=None, centery=None, angle=None, lambdaoverd=None)¶

given an x and y pixel position, generates a NxN flatmap that has a speckle at that position

given an x and y pixel position, generates a NxN flatmap that has a speckle at that position

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_math module¶

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_math.fitgaussian(xxx_todo_changeme, image)¶
medis.speckle_nulling.sn_math.gausspsf2d(npix, fwhm, normalize=True)¶
Parameters:
  • npix (int) – Number of pixels for each dimension. Just one number to make all sizes equal.
  • fwhm (float) – FWHM (pixels) in each dimension. Single number to make all the same.
  • normalize (bool, optional) – Normalized so total PSF is 1.
Returns:

psf – Gaussian point spread function.
Return type:

array_like
medis.speckle_nulling.sn_math.ideal2dpsf(xs, ys, xc, yc, pix=25, lambdaoverd=90.7, aoverA=0.32, fudgefactor=2.15, amp=1)¶

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing module¶

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.buildcube(filelist)¶

Takes a file list (of fits files) and constructs a single data cube out of them

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.combine_quadrants(image)¶

Take the 4 quadrants of PHARO and tile them as a single image of 1024x1024. Pass the raw fits data which is 4x512x512

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.crop(image, xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)¶
medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.equalize_image(data, bkgd=None, masterflat=None, badpix=None)¶

removes bad pixels from data, remove bad pixels from background, subtracts the two, and divides by the master flat field

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.gaussfunc(x, mu, sig)¶

1-d Gaussian x, mu, sigma

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.get_spot_locations(refimage, comment=None, eq=True)¶

get the position of a click in an image; note this is in imshow coordinates where the bottom left pixel is (-.5, -.5)

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.histeq(im, nbr_bins=256)¶

histogram equalize an image

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.linearize_and_align(image)¶

Not used: apply Stan Metchev’s distortion correction to PHARO

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.locate_badpix(data, sigmaclip=5)¶

locates bad pixels by fitting a gaussian distribution to the image intensity and then cutting outliers at the level of ‘sigmaclip’

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.poissfunc(x, mu)¶

Poisson distribution

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.quick2dairyfit(image, window=20)¶

return the parameters of a 2d airy fit to an image. the airy model is in pl_math called image_centroid_airy1

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.quick2dgaussfit(image, window=20, xy=None)¶

return the parameters of a 2d gaussian fit to an image. the gaussian model is in pl_math called image_centroid_gaussian1

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.quickalign(datacube, window=20)¶

quickly aligns a datacube to the first image around a user-clicked subwindow

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.quickcentroid(image, window=20)¶

quick gaussian centroid of a spot

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.removebadpix(data, mask, kernelsize=5)¶

removes bad pixels by replacing them with a 5x5 kernel median filter of the image where they exist

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.subimage(imagedata, center, window=20)¶

returns a subimage of size ‘window’ about a certain (x,y) pixel, passed as ‘center’

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.subimagecube(cubedata, cx, cy, window=20)¶

returns a subcube of size ‘window’ about a certain (x,y) pixel, passed as ‘center’

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.threshold(imagedata)¶

crude threshold, don’t do it

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.unsubimage(oldim, newimdata, cx, cy, window=20)¶

reinserts a image into the original cube

medis.speckle_nulling.sn_preprocessing.unsubimagecube(cube, newcubedata, cx, cy, window=20)¶

reinserts a subcube into the original cube
